subject: Public Speaking
title: What Is Rhetoric, Really?
description: One-minute skill: What Is Rhetoric, Really?.

hook.text: Rhetoric has a bad reputation. People think it means empty, manipulative talk. Aristotle would disagree.

buildup.text: Aristotle defined rhetoric as finding the available means of persuasion in any given situation.

discovery.text: That means rhetoric isn't trickery â€” it's the skill of making your case clearly and effectively.

twist.text: Every job interview, sales pitch, and bedtime negotiation with a toddler uses rhetoric. You already do it daily.

climax.text: Understanding rhetoric doesn't make you manipulative. It makes you aware of how persuasion already works around you.

punchline.text: Rhetoric isn't a weapon. It's a lens.

quiz.question: How did Aristotle define rhetoric?
options: Finding the available means of persuasion
